intro: Melampodium sinaloense, commonly known as the Sinaloan sunflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its bright yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and its flowers are arranged in a composite head. Melampodium sinaloense is often found in regions with warm, dry climates.
